intro: Monnina crotalarioides var. pseudoloxensis, commonly known as the Narrowleaf Monnina, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
